column2: 1. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column6: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column8: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column10: make alcohol the focus of the event.

column4: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column8: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 3. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 4. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column6: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column8: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column10: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.

column2: 5. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:

column6: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging
column8: Always come to a complete stop
column10: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way

column4: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column10: keep less space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 9. When passing a motorcycle you must:
column4: sound your horn to alert the motorcyclist.
column6: stay in the right lane as much as possible.
column8: give the motorcyclist the right hand part of his traffic lane.
column10: give the motorcyclist the entire traffic lane as if the motorcycle was a car.

column4: pulling out of a parking space.
column6: pulling into traffic from a parking area or alley.

column2: 11. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column4: Immediately come to a complete stop
column8: Slow down and be prepared to stop
column10: Proceed with caution through the intersection

column2: 12. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column6: wait until the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 13. When you approach a stop line, you should:
column4: stop after the stop line, but before the stop sign or traffic signal.
a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.
column8: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.

column2: 17. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column6: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column8: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column10: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.

column2: 18. During an emergency stop, always park on the left side of roadway, unless it is a one-way street.
20. When you are angry or upset you should:
column4: have a few drinks before driving.
column6: drive fast to let off steam.
column8: listen to loud music while driving.
column10: take a few minutes to cool off before you drive.

column8: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column6: You must turn right at the intersection

column2: 25. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column6: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column8: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column10: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
